title: Select a custom resolution and set it to smart size also for RDP session
author: phantomftr
body_snippet: I have my RDP sessions set to display at 1920x1080 and when I start the session in the main window it is too big so I need to then right click the session tab and select smart size so it fits into the window space properly.  I then sometimes switch these to full screen which is why I need to hard code them at 1920x1080 to fit the full screen.  If I just set the session to smart size it will not take the full screen space when going full screen and if I set the session to full screen it will disc...

iterations.description: Feature request to allow custom resolution input and combine any resolution with smart sizing for RDP sessions

comments.snippet:
I have the same problem here... Mremote NG uses the resolution of my main monitor witch is 4k and my mRemoteNG is on the second monitor witch is on 1920x1080. When I connect to a server with AutoResize ON. It opens with 4k resolution on my 1080 monitor. 
Any way to make mRemoteNG respect the monitor it is on instead of the main one?

comments.author: Stempoid
comments.snippet: Any progress on this one. Older posts suggest this should be possible by settings/appearance but this option has disappeared.

notes:
AI triage (claude): Feature request to allow custom resolution input and combine any resolution with smart sizing for RDP sessions
Approach: Add custom resolution fields (width/height) to ConnectionInfo and allow SmartSize to be applied independently of the resolution mode, so users can set e.g. 1920x1080 with smart sizing enabled. Modify SetResolution() default case to also enable SmartSizing when configured.
